content.body: ljharb: what's the preferred way to publish rendered specs in proposal repos?

content.body: there isn't consensus. the template i built does neither, it auto-publishes to the root

content.body: michael and some others prefer a separate gh-pages branch

content.body: i don't really care, i just want the least amount of work possible

content.body: i didn't know it could just use a single file?

content.body: you can make a proposal repo from the template for the "root" approach
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: you can make a proposal repo from the template for the "root" approach

content.body: oh i see, you can just serve the entire root directory
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: oh i see, you can just serve the entire root directory

content.body: the pros of this approach are that you can switch commits to specific ecmarkup and the rendered html is largely right there. cons are that the commit history will be slightly more crowded.
